HISTORY

  • 2008
  • 2011
  • 2013
  • 2014
  • MOVELLUS CIRCUITS INCORPORATED
  • PROTOTYPES 3-5 DEMONSTRATED
  • SECOND CHIP DEMONSTRATED
  • FIRST PROOF OF CONCEPT CHIP
  • 2008
    Movellus Circuits Incorporated was formed based on the pioneering research of Dr. David Wentzloff & Dr. Muhammad Faisal at the University of Michigan.
  • 2011
    Their research and expertise in innovative semiconductor design methodologies enabled the basis for Movellus’ core technology.
  • 2013
    After developing the core design methodologies, the first proof-of-concept prototype was fabricated and verified in 2008.
  • Since then five additional prototypes have been designed, fabricated and tested in order to perfect the technology.
  • 2014
    In April 2014, Dr. Faisal and Dr. Wentzloff formed Movellus Circuits to commercialize the technology.

TEAM

MUHAMMAD FAISAL

CEO AND CO-FOUNDER

Dr. Faisal is the Founder and CEO of Movellus Circuits. He has more than seven years of experience in the field of mixed-signal semiconductor design. Dr. Faisal is an expert in timing circuit design in advance CMOS technology nodes.
-
He received a B.S. degree in electrical engineering from the University of Waterloo, Canada, and M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in electrical engineering from the University of Michigan, where he developed Movellus’ innovative technology under the supervision of Dr. David Wentzloff. He has authored over ten technical papers in the filed of mixed-signal design, digital signal processing and nuclear particle detection.

+ READ MORE - READ LESS

DR. JEFFREY FREDENBURG

VP OF ENGINEERING AND CO-FOUNDER

Dr. Jeffrey Fredenburg is Co-Founder and VP of Engineering at Movellus Circuits. He is an accomplished analog and mixed-signal designer with prior experience in verification, testing, and characterization.
-
His past research and authorship has primarily focused on ADCs, but has contributed to the design of RF transceivers, novel oscillator designs, and highly integrated SoCs.
-
He earned his undergraduate and graduate degrees from the University of Michigan under excellent guidance of Professor Michael P. Flynn. Although his B.S.E., M.S.E., and Ph.D. are held in Electrical Engineering, Dr. Fredenburg completed extensive addition coursework in Philosophy and Nuclear Engineering while at the University of Michigan. During his graduate studies, Dr. Fredenburg was well known for leading research teams and for serving as faux advisor to many.

+ READ MORE - READ LESS

BOARD OF DIRECTORS

DR. MICHAEL MCCORQUODALE

Dr. Michael S. McCorquodale is an active Board Member and Advisor to several technology companies and an expert consultant through well-known consulting platforms as well as an independent long-term consultant.
-
Formerly, Dr. McCorquodale was the President, COO and a Co-Founder of e-SENS, a start-up that is developing instruments for chemical sensing in potable water using patented solid-state electrochemical technologies. Over the course of his year of service at e-SENS, he developed the business plan, raised first capital, established manufacturing partnerships, recruited the team and delivered the first functional prototypes. Leveraging those accomplishments, e-SENS has raised equity capital and continues to grow.

+ READ MORE - READ LESS

DAVID HARTMANN

President and founder of Arbor Blue – a service business focused on accelerating early stage business growth. As former President, CEO and founder of Avail Networks – a venture backed broadband equipment company – Dave joined Sycamore Networks upon the sale of ERI to Sycamore in September 2006 where he worked as part of the transistion management team.
-
Dave holds a part-time appontment as a Mentor In Residence with the University of Michigan Office of Technology Transfer where he works with research and managment professionals forming new business ventures. Dave joined ERI after successfully selling Avail to ERI in July 2003. Leveraging 25 years experience in telecommunications and networking, Dave advised ERI’s executive team on strategic corporate development initiatives, positioning ERI for strategic partnership, selection and engagement of investment banking services, and merger with Sycamore.

+ READ MORE - READ LESS

DR. DAVID WENTZLOFF

David Wentzloff is the VP of Engineering at PsiKick and is responsible for design, tape-outs, and implementation of PsiKick’s technology. Dr. Wentzloff is an expert in low-power wireless and RF circuit design.
-
His research interests include ultra-low power RFICs for energy- and volume-constrained applications, clock generation, and IC techniques to improve synchronization of sensor networks, wireless body area networks, channel modeling, and all-digital phase-locked loops for precision frequency generation. He received a B.S.E. degree in electrical engineering from the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, and M.S. and Ph.D. degrees in electrical engineering from MIT, where he and Dr. Calhoun first began their collaboration. Since August 2007, he has been on the faculty at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, where he is currently an Associate Professor of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science.
